channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2023100682
item.description:
Report E-2023100682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023100793
item.description:
Report E-2023100793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon pails of Kleanstrip (un1090) releasing 1 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023091079
item.description:
Report X-2023091079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handlers were unloading a trailer, and brought the damaged package to QA. DescribePack: The lids on the containers inside the package were not fully closed/tightened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package appeared to have only leaked inside the box and was placed in a hazmat bin inside a hazmat bag to prevent leaking outside of box if it happened. That I am aware of, this was done immediately, and at most, the only time it would have mostly been leaking was in transit to the station. With maybe 10 minutes of potential for leakage at our facility.
